io.netty.handler.codec

Class MessageToMessageDecoder<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter<I>
          • io.netty.handler.codec.MessageToMessageDecoder<I>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleInboundMessageHandler<I>, ChannelInboundMessageHandler<I>, ChannelStateHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Base64Decoder, ByteArrayDecoder, HttpContentDecoder, HttpObjectAggregator, ProtobufDecoder, SctpMessageToMessageDecoder, SpdyHttpDecoder, StringDecoder

    public abstract class MessageToMessageDecoder<I>
extends ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter<I>
    ChannelInboundMessageHandler which decodes from one message to an other message For example here is an implementation which decodes a String to an IntegerÂ which represent the length of the String. 
         public class StringToIntegerDecoder extends
             MessageToMessageDecoder<String> {
         public StringToIntegerDecoder() {
             super(String.class);
         }

         @Override
         public Object decode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, String message)
                 throws Exception {
             return message.length());
         }
     }

      • decode

        protected abstract Object decode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
            I msg)
                          throws Exception
        Decode from one message to an other. This method will be called till either the MessageBuf has nothing left or till this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this MessageToMessageDecoder belongs to
        msg - the message to decode to an other one
        Returns:
        message the decoded message or null if more messages are needed be cause the implementation needs to do some kind of aggragation
        Throws:
        Exception - is thrown if an error accour
